intro: Cissampelos abutua, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and fragrant, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, dark blue to black berries that are edible but often have a bitter taste. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value and medicinal properties make it a notable species in botanical studies.
